meanings.definition: To crunch or squeeze together tightly
meanings.sent1: She scrunched the paper into a ball.
meanings.sent2: The cat scrunched itself into a small box.
meanings.sent3: He scrunched his face in concentration while solving the puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The old car scrunched its way down the bumpy road.
meanings.sent5: The child scrunched the playdough in their hands, shaping it into different forms.

meanings.definition: To make a crunching or rustling noise
meanings.sent1: The leaves scrunched under his feet as he walked through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The bag of chips scrunched loudly when she opened it.
meanings.sent3: The wind scrunched the fallen leaves together in the corner of the yard.
meanings.sent4: The fire crackled and scrunched as it consumed the dry branches.
meanings.sent5: The footsteps scrunched on the gravel path, echoing in the quiet night.

meanings.definition: To hunch or curl up tightly
meanings.sent1: The cat scrunched into a ball on the windowsill.
meanings.sent2: She scrunched her body into the corner of the couch.
meanings.sent3: The hedgehog scrunched into a tight ball when it felt threatened.
meanings.sent4: The child scrunched up into a ball under the blanket during the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar scrunched up its body before turning into a butterfly.
